radiographic_examinations.findings: Prominent areas of low attenuation in both hemispheres, without contusions or hemorrhage.

Diffuse leptomeningeal enhancement, extensive asymmetric hyperintensity on T2-weighted and fluid-attenuated inversion recovery (FLAIR) images of the subcortical and deep white matter of the cerebral hemispheres, basal ganglia, and dorsal pons.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI performed 4 months later revealed extensive diffuse signal abnormality within the white matter, with some areas of improvement but new abnormalities in other areas.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Resolution of pachymeningeal enhancement but persistence of extensive confluent signal abnormalities in the white matter of both hemispheres.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI performed 2 years after initial examination revealed progression of white-matter signal abnormalities, with more extensive involvement of the cerebrum and especially the contents of the posterior fossa.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the head after treatment
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multifocal regions of hyperintense T2-weighted and FLAIR signal abnormalities, far less extensive than initial imaging studies.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Most of the white-matter abnormalities had resolved after treatment with glucocorticoids.
